private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H (A is smallest, H is largest among those).
I must only issue primitive moves of the form 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' for disks I control.
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so the global goal configuration is reached by cooperating with agent_2 under Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I can move disks: I, J, K, L, M, N, O (I is smallest among these, O is largest).
I must only issue primitive moves of the form 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' for disks I control.
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so the global goal configuration is reached by cooperating with agent_1 under Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and produce the final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards solver.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' move proposals and produce a single PDDL domain and problem that encodes the cooperative plan for the FastDownwards planner, keeping agent-specific actions distinct.

public_information: Classic Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time; a move consists of taking the top disk from a peg and placing it on top of another peg; a larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.
There are three pegs: left, middle, right.
Disks are labeled A (smallest) through O (largest).
Agents have restricted permissions: agent_1 may move disks A..H; agent_2 may move disks I..O.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) C, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has (top->bottom) B; right peg has (top->bottom) A, D.
All moves must respect agent disk ownership and the Tower of Hanoi stacking constraint.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi scenario with restricted disk permissions. You should produce an ordered list of primitive moves, each formatted exactly as: 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that involve disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H. Do not produce PDDL. Ensure every listed move respects the Tower of Hanoi rules (only top disks moved; never place a larger disk on a smaller). The sequence should be sufficient, together with agent_2's moves, to reach the global goal.

You are agent_2 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi scenario with restricted disk permissions. You should produce an ordered list of primitive moves, each formatted exactly as: 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that involve disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O. Do not produce PDDL. Ensure every listed move respects the Tower of Hanoi rules (only top disks moved; never place a larger disk on a smaller). The sequence should be sufficient, together with agent_1's moves, to reach the global goal.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive the ordered primitive move lists from agent_1 and agent_2. Your job is to integrate these moves, verify correctness with respect to the Tower of Hanoi rules and agent ownership constraints, and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownwards planner that encodes the cooperative plan. Keep actions of the two agents distinct (e.g., actions names or predicates should indicate agent_1 vs agent_2 when appropriate). Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownwards solver (use STRIPS/Axioms as appropriate and include any required :requirements and :strips declarations).
